contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox person |name = Irving Abella |image = |alt = |caption = |birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1940|7|2}} |birth_place = Toronto, Ontario |birth_name = Irving Martin Abella |death_date = <!-- {{Death date and age|YYYY|MM|DD|YYYY|MM|DD}} --> |death_place = |spouse = [[Rosalie Abella]] |other_names = |known_for = |occupation = writer, historian and academic |nationality = |awards = [[Order of Canada]] }} '''Irving Martin Abella''', {{Post-nominals|country=CAN|CM|FRSC}} (born July 2, 1940) is a [[Canada|Canadian]] writer, historian and academic. He specializes in the [[history of the Jews in Canada]] and the [[Labour movement|Canadian labour movement]] Born in [[Toronto]], [[Ontario]], he received his [[Bachelor of Arts]] degree (1963), [[Master of Arts (postgraduate)|Master of Arts]] (1964) degree, and [[Ph.D.]] (1969) from the [[University of Toronto]]. His books have included ''Coat of Many Colours: Two Centuries of Jewish Life in Canada'' (1990) and ''[[None is Too Many: Canada and the Jews of Europe 1933-1948]]'' (1982). He is a professor at [[York University]] and is a former president of the [[Canadian Jewish Congress]] (1992 to 1995). In 1993, he was made a Member of the [[Order of Canada]]<ref>{{OCC|1284}}</ref> and a Fellow of the [[Royal Society of Canada]]. He was awarded the [[Queen Elizabeth II Golden Jubilee Medal]] in 2002.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.gg.ca/honours.aspx?q=&t=6&p=ON&c=&pg=1&Province=ON&types=6&advgjmRegion=Canada|title=Golden Jubilee Medal}}</ref> He is married to Canadian jurist [[Rosalie Abella|Rosalie Silberman Abella]], who was appointed to the [[Supreme Court of Canada]] in August, 2004. They have two sons, Jacob and Zachary. Irving Abella is the cousin of [[Isaac Abella]]. ==References== {{reflist}} *[http://www.yorku.ca/uhistory/faculty/cv/abella.htm York University Curriculum Vitae] *[http://www.utpress.utoronto.ca/cgi-bin/cw2w3.cgi?p=aaron&t=18287&d=1850 Elizabeth Lumley (Editor),''Canadian Who's Who 2006'' University of Toronto Press, 2006, ISBN 978-0-8020-4054-1] {{S-start}} {{Succession box|title=President of the [[Canadian Jewish Congress]]| before=[[Les Scheininger]]| after=[[Goldie Hershon]]| years='''1992-1995'''}} {{S-end}} {{Authority control|VIAF=39344947}} {{Persondata | NAME = Abella, Irving | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Writer, historian, academic | DATE OF BIRTH = July 2, 1940 | PLACE OF BIRTH = Toronto, Ontario | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Abella, Irving}} [[Category:1940 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Canadian historians]] [[Category:Historians of Canada]] [[Category:Fellows of the Royal Society of Canada]] [[Category:Jewish Canadian writers]] [[Category:Canadian Jewish Congress]] [[Category:Jewish Canadian history]] [[Category:Members of the Order of Canada]] [[Category:Writers from Ontario]] [[Category:People from Old Toronto]] [[Category:University of Toronto alumni]] [[Category:York University faculty]] [[Category:Labor historians]] [[Category:Recipients of the Queen Elizabeth II Golden Jubilee Medal]] {{Canada-historian-stub}}
